response.answer_text: Documentary on the annals of Mohyals and my tribute to them:- Mohyal Brāhmaṇas were Savarṇā Senā and a paramilitary of Āryas that branched from Saraswats. Post the havoc Ashoka reeked undermining Brāhmaṇism, military-industrial complex of Bhāratavarṣa, Brāhmaṇas did their best to fill the vacuum in power structure by taking up kṣatriyaḥ udyoga and numerous Brāhmaṇa Rājyas were established within & outside Bhāratavarṣa. From the time of Paurava the Great who vanquished Alexander's expedition thwarting his aspirations till today Mohyals offer unrelenting service to our Mātṛubhūmī. Hindu Shahi Dynasty established by Mohyals acted as a fortress of Gāndhāra resisting Arabs and Gaznavids for three centuries. Mohyals played a pivotal role in the solidification of Sikhism from Bhai Sati Das, Mati Das, Banda Bahadhur assisting Sikh Gurus, becoming hutatma in the process. Mohyals helped consolidate Sikh empire. Brāhmaṇas disproportionately represented Swarajya and Swadeshi movements. 70% of the revolutionaries who became amara veeras were Brāhmaṇas. Of which Mohyals formed large numbers along with Bengali Brahmins, Chitpavans, Bhumihars, Tyagis. During partition, Mohyals formed militias to rescue the Hindus & Sikhs. Whenever Jihadis spotted Hindu caravans they attacked them but dared not to attack Mohyal's caravans. British would've clubbed Mohyals as Rajputs had it not been for Arya Samaj's intervention. Because British had an hard time fathoming the existence of militant race within Brāhmaṇa jātis since antiquity. 37.7% of officers at Indian Army are Brāhmaṇas and Mohyals would likely form a large chunk of it. They lend service to the ingrate state and are thriving in various fields because of their no nonsense attitude. This is deeply rooted in the psyche of martial jatis. Secondly jatis that closely-knit together prosper. If you want to learn about of Brāhmaṇic religio-culture, I recommend exhuming Surendranath Dasgupta's 5 vol. compendium---'A history of Indian philosophy' along with Dr. Radhakrishnan's two part---'Indian philosophy'. But if you're looking for kṣatriyaḥ exploits of Brāhmaṇas look upto Mohyals. Tamil Brāhmaṇas don't even have modicum of obstinacy neither do many other Brāhmaṇa upajātis. In order to survive in this Anti-Brāhmaṇical state surrounded by our enemies, our varṇā has to imbibe kṣatriyaḥtva and arm ourselves with Śāstra as well. Afterall Mohyals, Bhumihars, Chitpavans, Tyagis are genetically & Karmically related to us through patrinlineal Saptaṛṣi ancestry.

1st Sikh Guru Nanak Dev Ji revived the Sanatan tradition of Hinduism due to this many Hindus including Mohyal Brahmins. Bhai Kesar Singh Chibbar who wrote “Bansavalinama” a prominent Sikh text was a Mohyal Brahmin. Bhai Sati Das and Mati Das ji who were martyred alongside 9th Guru Teg Bahadur Ji were also Mohyal Brahmins. After 9th Guru Ji's martyrdom till Maharaja Ranjit Singh’s reign Mohyals retained high positions in Sikh courts. Banda Singh Bahadur who was a devotee of 10th Sikh Guru Gobind Singh Ji was a Dogra, other Dogras inspired by Banda Singh Bahadur started following Sikhism. Dogras held high positions in Lahore Raj until Punjab was occupied by British in 1849.
